channel.title: How to update PI to 474 interfaces?
channel.description: Is there a way? Can someone tell me how or point me to a guide please? I'm trying to learn as much about PI as possible, as I want to code my own PI source.

item.title: How to update PI to 474 interfaces?
item.dc:creator: @Clepto Clepto
item.description:
@Clepto wrote:

[quote=“ApocalypseX, post:2, topic:398967”][quote author=Clepto link=topic=496106.msg3626877#msg3626877 date=1307902138]
Is there a way? Can someone tell me how or point me to a guide please? I’m trying to learn as much about PI as possible, as I want to code my own PI source.
[/quote]
It’s definetly client-sided for one.
For two, go in your cache; and either download another client and steal its’ models/interfaces, and apply to your client.[/quote]

I think that would require changing a lot of the code of the client because I’m not sure but I think 474 interfaces are done a lot diferrrently than 317, but I might try finding a different client that already has them maybe, I was just kinda wondering if there was a guide for it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to update PI to 474 interfaces?

item.title: How to update PI to 474 interfaces?
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

Clepto:

Is there a way? Can someone tell me how or point me to a guide please? I’m trying to learn as much about PI as possible, as I want to code my own PI source.

It’s definetly client-sided for one.
For two, go in your cache; and either download another client and steal its’ models/interfaces, and apply to your client.

Read full topic
item.source: How to update PI to 474 interfaces?
